definition[0]: a system in which a government gives money to people who need a lawyer but cannot afford to pay for one
example[0]: They have been granted legal aid and now intend to take their case to court.
definition[1]: financial help given by a government organization to people involved in legal cases who cannot afford to pay for a lawyer themselves
example[1]: Clients who qualify for legal aid can choose between a salaried government lawyer or a lawyer in private practice.
